trans-unit.source: Poisson Regression
trans-unit.target: Poisson Regression

trans-unit.source: Creates a regression model that assumes data has a Poisson distribution
trans-unit.target: Creates a regression model that assumes data has a Poisson distribution

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Poisson Regression</ui> module to create a regression model that can be used to predict numeric values, typically counts.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Poisson Regression</ui> module to create a regression model that can be used to predict numeric values, typically counts.

trans-unit.source: You should use this model only if the values you are trying to predict fit these conditions:
trans-unit.target: You should use this model only if the values you are trying to predict fit these conditions:

trans-unit.source: The response variable has a <externalLink><linkText>Poisson distribution</linkText><linkUri>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The response variable has a <externalLink><linkText>Poisson distribution</linkText><linkUri>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Counts cannot be negative.
trans-unit.target: Counts cannot be negative.

trans-unit.source: The method will fail outright if you attempt to use it with negative labels.
trans-unit.target: The method will fail outright if you attempt to use it with negative labels.

trans-unit.source: Given that a Poisson distribution is a discrete distribution, it is not meaningful to use this method with non-whole numbers.
trans-unit.target: Given that a Poisson distribution is a discrete distribution, it is not meaningful to use this method with non-whole numbers.

trans-unit.source: If your target isn’t a count, Poisson regression is probably not an appropriate method.
trans-unit.target: If your target isn’t a count, Poisson regression is probably not an appropriate method.

trans-unit.source: After you have configured the model, you must train the model using a dataset that contains an example of the value you want to predict (the numeric label), using either <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep</link>.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured the model, you must train the model using a dataset that contains an example of the value you want to predict (the numeric label), using either <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep</link>.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to make predictions using <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to make predictions using <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Poisson Regression
trans-unit.target: Understanding Poisson Regression

trans-unit.source: Poisson regression is a special type of regression analysis that is typically used to model counts.
trans-unit.target: Poisson regression is a special type of regression analysis that is typically used to model counts.

trans-unit.source: For example, Poisson regression would be useful in these scenarios:
trans-unit.target: For example, Poisson regression would be useful in these scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Modeling the number of colds associated with airplane flights
trans-unit.target: Modeling the number of colds associated with airplane flights

trans-unit.source: Estimating the number of emergency service calls during an event, or estimating customer inquiries relating to a promotion
trans-unit.target: Estimating the number of emergency service calls during an event, or estimating customer inquiries relating to a promotion

trans-unit.source: Creating contingency tables
trans-unit.target: Creating contingency tables

trans-unit.source: Because the response variable has a Poisson distribution, the underlying assumptions about probability distribution are different from least-squares regression and Poisson models must be interpreted differently from other regression models.
trans-unit.target: Because the response variable has a Poisson distribution, the underlying assumptions about probability distribution are different from least-squares regression and Poisson models must be interpreted differently from other regression models.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more details of the formulas.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more details of the formulas.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Poisson Regression Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Poisson Regression Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Continue to set other parameters that affect the behavior of the regression model.
trans-unit.target: Continue to set other parameters that affect the behavior of the regression model.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can use these parameters to affect the model training process:
trans-unit.target: You can use these parameters to affect the model training process:

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Optimization tolerance
trans-unit.target: Optimization tolerance

trans-unit.source: Type a value that defines the tolerance interval during optimization.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that defines the tolerance interval during optimization.

trans-unit.source: The lower the value, the slower and more accurate the fitting.
trans-unit.target: The lower the value, the slower and more accurate the fitting.

trans-unit.source: <ui>L1 regularization weight</ui>, <ui>L2 regularization weight</ui>
trans-unit.target: <ui>L1 regularization weight</ui>, <ui>L2 regularization weight</ui>

trans-unit.source: Type values to use for L1 and L2 regularization.
trans-unit.target: Type values to use for L1 and L2 regularization.

trans-unit.source: <newTerm>Regularization</newTerm> adds constraints to the algorithm regarding aspects of the model that are independent of the training data.
trans-unit.target: <newTerm>Regularization</newTerm> adds constraints to the algorithm regarding aspects of the model that are independent of the training data.

trans-unit.source: Regularization is commonly used to avoid overfitting.
trans-unit.target: Regularization is commonly used to avoid overfitting.

trans-unit.source: In this module, you can apply a combination of L1 and L2 regularizations.
trans-unit.target: In this module, you can apply a combination of L1 and L2 regularizations.

trans-unit.source: L1 regularization is useful if the goal is to have a model that is as sparse as possible.
trans-unit.target: L1 regularization is useful if the goal is to have a model that is as sparse as possible.

trans-unit.source: L1 regularization is done by subtracting the L1 weight of the weight vector from the loss expression that the learner is trying to minimize.
trans-unit.target: L1 regularization is done by subtracting the L1 weight of the weight vector from the loss expression that the learner is trying to minimize.

trans-unit.source: The L1 norm is a good approximation to the L0 norm, which is the number of non-zero coordinates.
trans-unit.target: The L1 norm is a good approximation to the L0 norm, which is the number of non-zero coordinates.

trans-unit.source: L2 regularization prevents any single coordinate in the weight vector from growing too much in magnitude.
trans-unit.target: L2 regularization prevents any single coordinate in the weight vector from growing too much in magnitude.

trans-unit.source: L2 regularization is useful if the goal is to have a model with small overall weights.
trans-unit.target: L2 regularization is useful if the goal is to have a model with small overall weights.

trans-unit.source: By combining L1 and L2 regularizations, you can impose a penalty on the magnitude of the parameter values.
trans-unit.target: By combining L1 and L2 regularizations, you can impose a penalty on the magnitude of the parameter values.

trans-unit.source: The learner tries to minimize the penalty, in a tradeoff with minimizing the loss.
trans-unit.target: The learner tries to minimize the penalty, in a tradeoff with minimizing the loss.

trans-unit.source: Memory size for L-BFGS
trans-unit.target: Memory size for L-BFGS

trans-unit.source: Specify the amount of memory to reserve for model fitting and optimization.
trans-unit.target: Specify the amount of memory to reserve for model fitting and optimization.

trans-unit.source: L-BFGS is a technique used for optimization.
trans-unit.target: L-BFGS is a technique used for optimization.

trans-unit.source: The technique is based on the Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno (BFGS) algorithm, and specifies a limited amount of memory (L) to compute the next step direction.
trans-unit.target: The technique is based on the Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno (BFGS) algorithm, and specifies a limited amount of memory (L) to compute the next step direction.

trans-unit.source: By changing this parameter, you can affect the number of past positions and gradients that are stored for computation of the next step.
trans-unit.target: By changing this parameter, you can affect the number of past positions and gradients that are stored for computation of the next step.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you use <link xlink:href="986df333-6748-4b85-923d-871df70d6aaf" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Normalize Data</link> to normalize the input dataset before using it to train the regressor.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you use <link xlink:href="986df333-6748-4b85-923d-871df70d6aaf" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Normalize Data</link> to normalize the input dataset before using it to train the regressor.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: There are no examples of this learning algorithm in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: There are no examples of this learning algorithm in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: Poisson regression is classically used to model count data (the canonical example being calls to a switchboard in a given day), assuming that the label has a Poisson distribution, as parameterized by the interactions between the features x and the model parameters w,.
trans-unit.target: Poisson regression is classically used to model count data (the canonical example being calls to a switchboard in a given day), assuming that the label has a Poisson distribution, as parameterized by the interactions between the features x and the model parameters w,.

trans-unit.source: The prediction function outputs the expected value of that parameterized Poisson distribution, specifically: <legacyItalic>f</legacyItalic><subscript>w,b</subscript><math>(x) = E[Y|x] = e</math><superscript>w</superscript><superscript>T</superscript><superscript>x+b</superscript>.
trans-unit.target: The prediction function outputs the expected value of that parameterized Poisson distribution, specifically: <legacyItalic>f</legacyItalic><subscript>w,b</subscript><math>(x) = E[Y|x] = e</math><superscript>w</superscript><superscript>T</superscript><superscript>x+b</superscript>.

trans-unit.source: The log probability can be viewed as <math>log</math><legacyItalic>p</legacyItalic><math>(y = y</math><subscript>i</subscript>)
trans-unit.target: The log probability can be viewed as <math>log</math><legacyItalic>p</legacyItalic><math>(y = y</math><subscript>i</subscript>)

trans-unit.source: Given a training dataset, Poisson regression tries to find the optimal values by maximizing the log likelihood of the parameters.
trans-unit.target: Given a training dataset, Poisson regression tries to find the optimal values by maximizing the log likelihood of the parameters.

trans-unit.source: The likelihood of the parameters is the probability that the training data was sampled from a distribution with these parameters.
trans-unit.target: The likelihood of the parameters is the probability that the training data was sampled from a distribution with these parameters.

trans-unit.source: With less memory, training is faster but less accurate the training.
trans-unit.target: With less memory, training is faster but less accurate the training.

trans-unit.target: Leave blank for default.

trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.target: true

trans-unit.target: Indicate whether an additional level should be created for each categorical column.

trans-unit.source: Any levels in the test dataset not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.
trans-unit.target: Any levels in the test dataset not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.
